title: How to Make Garlic Hummus

steps.headline: Drain and rinse the chickpeas and set aside.
Peel the garlic and chop it up a little bit before placing it in the food processor.
steps.description: To make roasted garlic hummus, wrap the garlic (with peels) in a foil & put in 425°F Preheated Oven and let them roast for about 25 mins. Unwrap & let it cool. Peel off the skin & use. Alternatively you can also roast the garlic by wrapping it in a foil & roasting them on a BBQ or Stove.

steps.headline: Chop some of the stems off the parsley before placing it in the food processor (optional).
Add about 1/2 of the chickpeas, 2–3 tablespoon (29.6–44.4 ml).
Add remaining chickpeas and blend again, with more oil if needed.
steps.description: Mixture should be creamy, but fairly thick.

steps.headline: Season to taste with spices of choice, along with salt and pepper if desired.

text: Drain and rinse the chickpeas and set aside.  Peel the garlic and chop it up a little bit before placing it in the food processor. To make roasted garlic hummus, wrap the garlic (with peels) in a foil & put in 425°F Preheated Oven and let them roast for about 25 mins. Unwrap & let it cool. Peel off the skin & use. Alternatively you can also roast the garlic by wrapping it in a foil & roasting them on a BBQ or Stove. Chop some of the stems off the parsley before placing it in the food processor (optional).  Add lemon juice and blend.  Add about 1/2 of the chickpeas, 2–3 tablespoon (29.6–44.4 ml). tahini and 2 tablespoon (29.6 ml). oil. Blend.  Add remaining chickpeas and blend again, with more oil if needed. Mixture should be creamy, but fairly thick. Season to taste with spices of choice, along with salt and pepper if desired.  Finished.
